name: Ancient Booster Energy Capsule
rules: The Ancient Pokémon this card is attached to gets +60 HP, recovers from all Special Conditions, and can't be affected by any Special Conditions.
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

name: Counter Catcher
rules: You can use this card only if you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent.  Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Cursed Duster
rules: If the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, discard a random card from your opponent's hand.
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

name: Defiance Vest
rules: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, the Pokémon this card is attached to takes 40 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

name: Earthen Vessel
rules: You can use this card only if you discard another card from your hand.  Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Future Booster Energy Capsule
rules: The Future Pokémon this card is attached to has no Retreat Cost, and the attacks it uses do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

name: Larry
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If tails, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Luxurious Cape
rules: If the Pokémon this card is attached to doesn't have a Rule Box, it gets +100 HP, and if it is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, that player takes 1 more Prize card. (Pokémon ex, Pokémon V, etc. have Rule Boxes.)
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

name: Mela
rules: You can use this card only if any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn.    Attach a Basic Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Norman
rules: Draw 2 cards. If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Parasol Lady
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 4 cards. If you go second and it's your first turn, draw 8 cards instead.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Professor Sada's Vitality
rules: Choose up to 2 of your Ancient Pokémon and attach a Basic Energy card from your discard pile to each of them. If you attached any Energy in this way, draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Professor Turo's Scenario
rules: Put 1 of your Pokémon in play into your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that Pokémon.)
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Rika
rules: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and put 2 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards and put them on the bottom of your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Roark
rules: Draw 2 cards. Put a Basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Shauntal
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot. If tails, switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Snorlax Doll
rules: If this card is in your hand when you are setting up to play, you may put it face down in the Active Spot or on your Bench as if it were a 120-HP Basic Colorless Pokémon. (You can do this only when you are setting up to play.) At any time during your turn, you may discard this card from play.     This card can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. If this card is Knocked Out, your opponent can't take any Prize cards for it.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Technical Machine: Blindside
rules: The Pokémon this card is attached to can use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.) If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of your turn.
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

attacks.name: Blindside
attacks.text: This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Technical Machine: Devolution
rules: The Pokémon this card is attached to can use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.) If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of your turn.
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

attacks.name: Devolution
attacks.text: Devolve each of your opponent's evolved Pokémon by putting the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.

name: Technical Machine: Evolution
rules: The Pokémon this card is attached to can use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.) If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of your turn.
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

attacks.name: Evolution
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Technical Machine: Turbo Energize
rules: The Pokémon this card is attached to can use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.) If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of your turn.
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

attacks.name: Turbo Energize
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Techno Radar
rules: You can use this card only if you discard another card from your hand.    Search your deck for up to 2 Future Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Tulip
rules: Put up to 4 in any combination of Psychic Pokémon and Basic Psychic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Larry
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If tails, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Beach Court
rules: The Retreat Cost of each Basic Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) is Colorless less.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

rules: You can use this card only if you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent.  Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.
